Empowering marketers with powerful analytics around inbox placement, sender reputation, and email content, MailMonitor is used by the world's largest email senders.
ZenPhone is an inbound calling solution that converts long distance numbers into free-to-call local numbers for your website visitors.

Nariveda manufactures Anti-Aging Ayurvedic Elixirs formulated with clinically proven, plant based phytonutrients. Each elixir contains in excess of 100 earth grown nutrients suspended in a base of bio molecules small enough to infiltrate the center of the cell for maximum bioavailability and near instant effects. Learn more at www.nariveda.com

-ACQUIRED by Retail Me Not Inc. http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/blog/techflash/2016/04/texas-retail-tech-firm-acquires-phoenix-startup.htmlGiftcard Zen is one of the largest online retailers for used gift cards. -Led a national sales team that grew revenue 600% from $10M to $60M in less than 15 months putting Giftcard Zen in the top 5 fastest growing companies in the United States.-Developed strategies around gift card pricing to grow Gross Profit Margin from 5.5%-12% over 12 months.-Fostered the growth of a high-performance culture focused around health, mindfulness, happiness and continued success.

recommendations: Timothy Stewart Clark
Associate Professor of Strategic Management
June 25, 2015, Timothy Stewart was Adrian’s teacher

Few former students have impressed me so favorably, with both personal and professional qualities, as Adrian Patel-Delaloye.  In my Managerial Decision Making (MGT 475) senior seminar course in Spring 2013, Adrian produced good results on projects and exams, but he truly distinguished himself by consistently demonstrating the kinds of behavioral qualities that are crucial for reliably contributing to a growing organization's productivity and collegiality.  Throughout the semester, he always seemed interested and engaged in class discussions and made contributions of insights that helped the entire class to learn and be more productive.  His points usually reflected uncommonly good critical thinking, with contrarian or provocative aspects expressed with professionalism -- an essential quality for breaking through mere group-think.  Basically, he showed the kind of personable enthusiasm and intellectual curiosity that made my job easier and raised the results for everyone.  That semester and ever since, Adrian seems remarkably willing to confront the uncertainties of real-world business issues, recognizing that “answers” in business are not found on certain pages in textbooks rather must be tackled through hard work, applied thought, and creative collaboration, and I’ve seen him extend these qualities markedly in his first few years working in industry.  It’s been a pleasure to remain in contact with Adrian, not least because I admire the type of roles he has taken on and the types of contributions he has made, as these exemplify entrepreneurial qualities I see as being most valuable to highly aspirational companies.  If I could have a “dream team” class comprised of my best students of recent years, Adrian would certainly be on it.  So with respect to bold, entrepreneurial thinking with the personal and leadership skills to turn ideas into action, Adrian has my highest recommendation.
Timothy Stewart Clark
Associate Professor of Strategic Management

Director of Marketing | #yesphx
June 16, 2015, Adrian was senior to Paige but didn’t manage directly

Since joining the Giftcard Zen team, I have had the pleasure of working with Adrian on a number of projects. He is a natural born leader who thrives in situations where a team is working together towards a greater purpose. He is constantly growing, learning and improving upon the status quo. During his time as VP Growth, Giftcard Zen was named the Fastest Growing Company in Arizona. This incredible achievement can be credited to Adrian's dedicated work towards building our Volume Partner Program and the sales team as a whole. His energy is contagious and any organization will be fortunate to have him as a leader and part of their team.

summary: Adrian Patel-Delaloye is a driven entrepreneur with an obsession for health, art and adventure. During his childhood, he lived in six countries while traveling with his entrepreneurial, hippy parents. This constant change early on broadened his perspective on both education and business.Adrian attended Northern Arizona University to study Biomedical Science and Business Administration. During his time at NAU, he was inspired to start a number of projects including CardaMints and Parallel.Parallel grew quickly, so Adrian decided to build a team to turn the idea into a reality. The mission was to create an app to revolutionize the way personal connections were curated on mobile mediums, a passion that ties directly into his love of travel and meeting new people. Despite bootstrapping early on, finances later forced the team to pursue other career possibilities.At the time Parallel came to a close, Adrian was approached by the Giftcard Zen team. He soon realized the potential behind the business model and joined the team as an Account Manager. He quickly moved up in the company to Head of Sales and again to Vice President of Growth. Giftcard Zen was acquired by publicly-traded, Retail Me Not INC., for $32M.
name: Adrian Patel-Delaloye
title: Founder at ZenPhone, Nariveda, & OMG! Popping Chocolate
